data.name: Sample - AWS Commands - 1.0.0
data.description: Sample playbooks for "AWS Commands" connector. If you are planning to use any of the sample playbooks in your environment, ensure that you clone those playbooks and move them to a different collection, since the sample playbook collection gets deleted during connector upgrade and delete.

workflows.name: Volume: Detach Volume
workflows.description: Detaches a volume from an AWS Commands instance based on the volume ID, Device Name, and instance ID you have specified.

workflows.name: Detach Instance From Auto Scaling Group
workflows.description: Detaches an EC2 instance from the auto scaling group on AWS Commands based on the auto scaling group name and instance ID (s) you have specified.

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Detach Instance From Auto Scaling Group

steps.name: Detach Instance From Auto Scaling Group

arguments.name: AWS
arguments.operationTitle: Detach Instance From Auto Scaling Group

routes.name: Alerts -> Detach Instance From Auto Scaling Group

workflows.name: Attach Instance To Auto Scaling Group
workflows.description: Attaches a running instance to the auto scaling group on AWS Commands based on the auto scaling group name and instance ID (s) you have specified.

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Attach Instance To Auto Scaling Group

steps.name: Attach Instance To Auto Scaling Group

arguments.name: AWS Commands
arguments.operationTitle: Attach Instance To Auto Scaling Group

routes.name: Alerts -> Attach Instance To Auto Scaling Group

workflows.name: Instance: Reboot Instance
workflows.description: Reboots an instance you have specified using the instance ID on AWS Commands.

workflows.name: Instance: Stop Instance
workflows.description: Stops an instance you have specified using the instance ID on AWS Commands.

workflows.name: Security Group: Revoke Ingress
workflows.description: Removes (revokes) egress rules from a security group on AWS Commands based on the security group ID, and IP permissions you have specified.

workflows.name: Instance: Deregister Instance from ELB
workflows.description: Deregisters an AWS Commands instance to the elastic load balancing (ELB) service on AWS based on the ELB name and instance ID you have specified.

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Deregister Instance from ELB

workflows.name: Get AMIs Details
workflows.description: Retrieves details for all AMIs (Amazon Machine Images) or specific AMIs, based on input parameters you have specified, from AWS.

routes.name: Alerts -> Get Details for All Images

workflows.name: Volume: Attach Volume
workflows.description: Attaches a volume to an AWS Commands instance based on the volume ID, Device Name, and instance ID you have specified.

workflows.name: Instance: Add Instance Tag
workflows.description: Adds a tag to an available AWS Commands instance you have specified using the instance ID.Tags must be added in a key-value pair.

workflows.name: Instance: Launch Instance
workflows.description: Launches a new instance on AWS having basic configuration based on the image ID, instance type, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: ACL: Delete Network ACL
workflows.description: Deletes the specified network ACL. from AWS Commands, based on the Network ACL ID you have specified.

workflows.name: ACL: Delete Network ACL Rule
workflows.description: Deletes the network ACL from AWS Commands,  based on the network ACL ID, Egress rule, and rule number you have specified.

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Delete Network ACL Rule

workflows.name: Instance: Add Security Group to Instance
workflows.description: Adds a security group to an AWS Commands instance based on the security group name(s) or ID(s) and instance ID you have specified.

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Add Security Group to Instance

routes.name: Alerts -> Add Security Group to Instance

workflows.name: Security Group: Get Details of Security Group
workflows.description: Retrieves details of given security group from the AWS Commands service.

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Get Details of Security Group

routes.name: Start -> Get Details of Security Group

workflows.name: ACL: Get Details of Network ACLs
workflows.description: Retrieves details of one or more of your network ACLs from AWS Commands, based on the Network ACL IDs and filters you have specified.

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Get Details of Network ACLs

routes.name: Alerts -> Get Details of Network ACLs

workflows.name: Security Group: Delete Security Groups
workflows.description: Deletes a security group you have specified, using the security group ID.

workflows.name: Instance: Register Instance To ELB
workflows.description: Registers an AWS Commands instance to the elastic load balancing (ELB) service on AWS based on the ELB name and instance ID you have specified

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Register Instance To ELB

workflows.name: Get User Details
workflows.description: Retrieves details for a user you have specified, using the username from AWS.

workflows.name: Instance: Start Instance
workflows.description: Starts an instance you have specified using the instance ID on AWS Commands.

workflows.name: Security Group: Get Security Groups
workflows.description: Retrieves details of all security groups from the AWS Commands service.

workflows.name: Security Group: Authorize Egress
workflows.description: Adds (authorizes) egress rules to a security group on AWS Commands based on the security group ID, and IP permissions you have specified

workflows.name: ACL: Add Network ACL Rule
workflows.description: Adds a rule to the network access control list (ACL) on AWS Commands based on the Network ACL ID, egress rule, and other input parameters you have specified.

arguments.title: AWS Commands: Add Network ACL Rule

workflows.name: Security Group: Revoke Egress
workflows.description: Removes (revokes) egress rules from a security group on AWS Commands based on the security group ID, and IP permissions you have specified.

workflows.name: Volume: Delete Volume
workflows.description: Deletes a volume you have specified, using the volume ID.

workflows.name: Instance: Instance API Termination
workflows.description: Terminates an instance on AWS Commands using the REST API, if you have enabled this operation based on the instance ID and action you have specified.

workflows.name: Instance: Terminate Instance
workflows.description: Terminates an AWS Commands instance you have specified using the instance ID.

workflows.name: Security Group: Authorize Ingress
workflows.description: Adds (authorizes) ingress rules to a security group on AWS Commands based on the security group ID, CIDR IP value, and other input parameters you have specified.

workflows.name: Instance: Get Instance Details
workflows.description: Retrieves details for an instance you have specified, using the instance ID from AWS Commands.

workflows.name: Volume: Capture Volume Snapshot
workflows.description: Captures a snapshot of a volume on AWS Commands based on the volume ID and volume description you have specified.

workflows.name: Security Group: Create Security Groups
workflows.description: Creates a new security group in the AWS Commands service based on the group name and description you have specified.

params.description: Creating security group by CyOPs playbook

workflows.name: ACL: Create Network ACL
workflows.description: Creates a network ACL in AWS Commands in the VPC you have specified.
